incident.incidentdescription:
19 May 2010 (Wednesday)

3x trucks torched and 10x cars stoned after residents barricade R50 highway and other roads leading into Lebogang township.

No arrests reported.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Roads barricaded and vehicles torched / stoned

incident.incidentdescription:
28 April 2010 (Wednesday)

Estimated 300x protesters barricade roads with burning tires.

2x shops torched, and 2x trucks stoned on R50 & R29 highways.

4x protesters arrested in Lebohang township after police dismantle barricades.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Arson and highway blockade results in four arrests

incident.incidentdescription:
28 April 2010 (Wednesday)

Mpumalanga community safety MEC Sibongile Manana "rushes" to Lebohang to meet with Leandra Peace Committee after national government says "the township is in flames and there are no police officers to stabilise the situation".

Asks for patience and a freeze on public protests until the province has had an opportunity to consider and respond to demands for improved service delivery.
incident.incidenttitle: INTERVENTION - Community Safety MEC meets with protestors

incident.incidentdescription:
30 April 2010 (Friday)

Mpumalanga community safety MEC Sibongile Manana stages a "tense" meeting with the Leandra Youth Concerned Committee (LYCC) during which she calls for an immediate lifting of barricades and worker boycotts.

LYCC demands Leandra's cession to Gauteng province, demands dismissal of all elected councillors, and demands delivery of basic services including housing and electricity.

Manana promises comprehensive government response to community demands "within two weeks".
incident.incidenttitle: INTERVENTION - Community Safety MEC meets with Leandra Youth Concerned Committee

incident.incidentdescription:
27 March 2010 (Saturday)

The Independent Complaints Directorate (ICD) formally began investigations into the fatal shooting of 1x protester and gunshot injuries to 2x other protesters after police use 'live' ammunition to disperse demonstrators at funeral of protest leader (need details).
incident.incidenttitle: INTERVENTION - ICD launches investigation into police shootings

incident.incidentdescription:
20 March 2010 (Saturday)

Protesters torch the Leslie municipal office, civic centre, police vehicles, and a construction company office.

Protesters also barricade R50, & stone private vehicles.

13x protesters arrested, after police open fire with rubber bullets.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Government building torched in arson attacks

incident.incidentdescription:
27 March 2010 (Saturday)

1x 21yr-old dead & 2x youths injured after police shoot demonstrators at protest leaders' funeral.

Police report being fired on. Devon Rd also barricaded & vehicles stoned by demonstrators.
incident.incidenttitle: DEATH - Police shoot youth, injure two others in clash at funeral

incident.incidentdescription:
19 May 2010 (Wednesday)

1x 13yr-old in critical condition after being hit in head with rubber bullet during violent demonstration by pupils affiliated with Olievenhoutbosch Backyard Dwellers Association.

20x arrested for stoning, firebombing police vehicles & barricading streets

DEMANDS: corrupt councillors should be removed + illegal immigrants should be evicted from local low-cost housing.

MEMORANDUM: claim to have delivered three memoranda to council -- no answer
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Pupils petrolbomb police

incident.incidentdescription:
14 May 2010 (Friday)

Mpumalanga cooperative governance MEC Norman Mokoena tells provincial legislature that service delivery riots have cost government R40m in damages, + 84 days of work due to closure of municipal offices in affected towns.
incident.incidenttitle: INTERVENTION - Riots cost Mpumalanga R40m

incident.incidentdescription:
24 July 2009 (Friday)

100x protesters, including minors, are released on their own recognisance ("on warning") as part of a deal with state prosecutors after the trial date is set for 24 August 2009 on charges of public violence & arson.
incident.incidenttitle: INTERVENTION - 100 protesters appear in court for public violence

incident.incidentdescription:
22 July 2009 (Wednesday)

Police fire rubber bullets & tear gas at protesters, after they stone mayor.

11x protesters released from custody without charge.

20x protesters released on bail, after being charged with public violence & arson.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - 30 arrested after protesters stone mayor

incident.incidentdescription:
20 July 2009 (Monday)

Somali-owned shops targeted, looted, & torched by protesters.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Demonstraters loot and torch Somalis' shops

incident.incidentdescription:
19 July 2009 (Sunday)

Mayor's house and municipal buildings petrol-bombed by protesters.

31x demonstrators arrested on public violence and arson charges.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - 31 arrested after mayor's home, town hall torched

incident.incidentdescription:
04 August 2009 (Tuesday)

South African President Jacob Zuma visits Siyathemba township on "fact-finding" tour into riots.
incident.incidenttitle: INTERVENTION - President Zuma visits Siyathemba after riots

incident.incidentdescription:
31 March 2010 (Wednesday)

Residents warn of further violent protests unless national Cooperative Governance minister Sicelo Shiceka returns to report-back on previous community concerns / demands.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Residents threaten further riots unless demands met

incident.incidentdescription:
14 October 2009 (Wednesday)

Protesters barricade roads to prevent traffic into eMzinoni township (need more detail).
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Demonstraters barricade roads

incident.incidentdescription:
18 March 2010 (Thursday)

1x protester injured by police

1x police armoured vehicle (Casper), + 7x private vehicles torched, 20x others stoned during protests.

32x protesters arrested

Protestors complain local mines giving jobs to foreigners instead of locals.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Demonstraters ambush, petrolbomb police Casper

incident.incidentdescription:
14 March 2010 (Sunday)

Local villagers take councillors and municipal officials hostage, after they are told that local service problems can only be fixed in June 2010.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Villagers take councillors hostage

incident.incidentdescription:
14 March 2010 (Sunday)

Residents gather to demand explanations for municipal failure to address previous complaints & memorandums.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Residents demand response to memorandum

incident.incidentdescription:
09 February 2010 (Tuesday)

Youths petrol-bomb municipal library, stone police, barricade roads in Siyathemba township.

Police fire rubber bullets at demonstrators from inside Casper armoured vehicle.

No injuries, no arrests reported.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Youths torch library, stone police

incident.incidentdescription:
12 February 2010

Police accused of assaulting protest leader's father, during manhunt.

ICD launch investigation.
incident.incidenttitle: INJURY - Police allegedly assault protest leader's father

incident.incidentdescription:
18 February 2010 (Thursday)

2x mayor resigned
2x speaker resigned
1x chief whip resigned
19x councillors recalled, 2x charged criminally
1x municipal manager resigned
1x chief financial officer resigned


14x official suspended, charged with irregularities
incident.incidenttitle: INTERVENTION - Municipal managers, councillors sacked in wake of riots

incident.incidentdescription:
07 February 2010 (Sunday)

3x foreign-owned shops attacked and torched, with 22x others looted (more details needed).
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Mob torches foreign-owned stores

incident.incidentdescription:
08 February 2010 (Monday)

16x protesters arrested after attacked on foreign-owned shops / homes in Siyathemba.

15x foreigners flee Siyathemba, staying overnight in Balfour police station.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - 16 arrested for xenophobic attacks

incident.incidentdescription:
18 February 2010 (Thursday)

2x police officers injured during stoning
1x protester injured by rubber bullet
6x protesters arrested

DEMANDS: That BHP Billiton mine stop hiring foreigners, and hire locals instead.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Demonstrators ambush, injure 2 policemen

incident.incidentdescription:
14 October 2009 (Wednesday)

Police use rubber bullets to disperse protesters after they stone Mayor, demand answers within six days.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Protesters stone mayor

incident.incidentdescription:
6 April 2010 (Tuesday)

1x demonstrator shot & killed during police round-up of protest leaders, after town hall and councillor's house petrol-bombed. 

Police claim self-defense - man allegedly stoned them.

No arrests or other injuries reported.
incident.incidenttitle: INJURY - Protester killed in police shooting

incident.incidentdescription:
05 April 2010 (Monday)

11x arrested for arson & public violence after petrol-bombing councillor's house & community hall, + barricading roads.

Complaints about service delivery, & lack of consultation.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - 11 arrested for torching councillor's house

incident.incidentdescription:
15 June 2009 (Monday)

Protesters barricade roads, burn tires, demand basic services & consultation with community.

Hand over memorandum.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Protesters hand over memorandum of demands

incident.incidentdescription:
21 May 2010 (Friday)

DA & ANC in rare display of solidarity pass joint Legislature motion calling on authorities to urgently intervene in Leandra to address community grievances.
incident.incidenttitle: INTERVENTION - ANC and DA call on government to intervene in Leandra

incident.incidentdescription:
20 Thursday 2010 (Thursday)

2x suspected robbers stoned & beaten to death by mob of Kwaggafontein villagers.

No arrests reported.
incident.incidenttitle: VIGILANTE - Two suspected robbers stoned to death

incident.incidentdescription:
13 February 2010 (Saturday)

400x protesters march on authorities, hand over memorandum demanding that Albert Luthuli Municipality in Carolina provide basic water, electricity, housing & roads. (need more details)
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Villagers hand over memorandum

incident.incidentdescription:
26 March 2010 (Friday)

Protesters stone police after officers try close tavern. Police report "bringing situation under control".

No arrests, no injuries reported.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Residents stone police after tavern ordered to close

incident.incidentdescription:
27 March 2010 (Saturday)

Protesters barricade streets, burn tires, and stone Msukalekwa mayor Bheki Vilakazi's house: damaging house, mayor's car, + bodyguard's car.

8x protesters arrested near Mayor's house
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Residents attack mayor's house

incident.incidentdescription:
04 March 2010 (Thursday)

Residents had memorandum to Msukalekwa mayor Bheki Vilakazi. (need more details)
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Residents hand memorandum to mayor

incident.incidentdescription:
11 October 2009 (Sunday)

1x policeman injured when protesters barricade R23 & stone police / private vehicles

1x protester injured when police use rubber bullets to disperse demonstrators.

22x arrested in follow-up police operation.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Policeman injured, 22 arrested during riot

incident.incidentdescription:
14 October 2009 (Wednesday)

2x bus petrol-bombed at entrance to eMbalenhle township

6x arrested for barricading roads & stoning vehicles.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Demonstrators petrol-bomb buses

incident.incidentdescription:
25 March 2010 (Thursday)

Mpumpalanga municipal chief suspended

The municipal manager of Emalahleni in Mpumalanga has been suspended following an investigation into service delivery problems, the province's co-operative governance MEC said yesterday. The department conducted an investigation and compiled a report after residents complained that the municipality was not meeting its constitutional obligations. The report focused on allegations of maladministration, fraud, nepotism, corruption and poor service delivery. - Sapa
incident.incidenttitle: INTERVENTION - Municipal manager suspended in wake of riots

incident.incidentdescription:
24 March 2010 (Wednesday)

Cooperative governance MEC Norman Mokoena visits Moloto village to appeal for calm after politicians houses + public buildings torched. (need more details of original riots).
incident.incidenttitle: INTERVENTION - MEC Mokoena appeals for calm after politicians attacked

incident.incidentdescription:
23 March 2010 (Tuesday)

500x protersters petrol-bomb councillor Peter Mokone's house @ 2am then torch councillor Michael Danisa's house. Police airlift both politicos & families to safety.

18x arrested on malicious damage to property

1x church + 1x shop torched

R573 barricaded & private vehicles stoned
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Politicians airlifted to safety after mob attacks, burns homes

incident.incidentdescription:
14 February 2009 (Saturday)

Moutse protesters tear down & burn ANC posters, demanding cession from Limpopo and reincorporation into Mpumalanga.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Moutse residents demand reincorporation into Mpumalanga

incident.incidentdescription:
23 March 2010 (Tuesday)

Protesters "go on rampage" after politicians fail to explain service delivery delays. (need more details).
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Residents go on 'rampage'

incident.incidentdescription:
24 February 2010 (Wednesday)

Protesters barricade roads, disrupt taxi & other public transport services and demand dismissal of Steve Tshwete Municipality's mayor after council fails to answer demands for flushing toilets & other basic services.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Residents barricade roads in demand for flushing toilets

incident.incidentdescription:
29 March 2010 (Monday)

14x foreign-owned businesses attacked by protestors in Mhluzi township. Pakistani, Ethiopian and Somalian properties specifically targeted.

1x shop torched. No injuries reported.

13x arrests reported by police.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Mob attacks foreigners, torches shop

incident.incidentdescription:
24 February 2010 (Wednesday)

10,000x demonstrators (SABC estimate) gather outside Middelburg council building to accuse mayor Mantlhakeng Mahlangu of "dictatorship" and failing to deliver basic services.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Thousands march on mayor, demanding flushing toilets

incident.incidentdescription:
13 October 2009 (Tuesday)

1x policeman injured during stoning of eMakhazeni Municipal Manager Oscar Nkosi after memorandum handed over.

18x arrested after protesters barricade streets, stone police & municipal buildings.
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Policeman injured, 18 arrested after mob attacks mayor

incident.incidentdescription:
14 October 2009 (Wednesday)

43x arrested for for malicious damage to property during protest (details needed).
incident.incidenttitle: PROTEST - Police arrest 43 demonstrators
